dt: {bc}to use the Google {d_link|search engine|search engine} to obtain information about (someone or something) on the World Wide Web

utxt.t: The Massachusetts trio may not have picked an easily {wi}Googleable{/wi} name …

quotes.t: The Sports Gal and I delayed dinner plans so I could analyze the replays like a police chief. Eventually she realized we weren't leaving the house, so she made herself a sandwich and headed upstairs to {qword}Google{/qword} divorce lawyers.
Have you ever {qword}googled{/qword} yourself, maybe late at night, when nobody else was around? It's OK, you can admit it—everybody does it.

Then where are they going, if not to Faulkner and Achebe and Naipaul?  … To the movies; to television (hours and hours); to {qword}Googling{/qword} obsessively (hours and hours); to blogging and emailing and text messaging …

shortdef: to use the Google search engine to obtain information about (someone or something) on the World Wide Web
